item.title: Compiling error
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“EMINEM BEAST™, post:12, topic:372412”][quote author=xx matty xx link=topic=468465.msg3424937#msg3424937 date=1291844188]
What, you get the same error again? Add another bracket
[/quote]brackets don’t solve everything, he or she might have messed up some where else.

And this is a PI server right?[/quote]
The error says that the compiler got to the end of the file but expected more code. I can’t think of any other reason than missing closing braces.

You are adding the braces to the end of the file, right?

item.title: Compiling error
item.dc:creator: @x_sam_x1 x sam x
item.description:
@x_sam_x1 wrote:

i have honestly being playing around with it for hours.
I could add more to the code.

if (playerCommand.startsWith("ipmute") && c.playerRights >= 1) { try { String playerToBan = playerCommand.substring(7); for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToBan)) { Connection.addIpToMuteList(Server.playerHandler.players[i].connectedFrom); c.sendMessage("You have IP Muted the user: "+Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName); Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i]; c2.sendMessage("You have been muted by: " + c.playerName); break; } } } } catch(Exception e) { c.sendMessage("Player Must Be Offline."); } } if (playerCommand.startsWith("unipmute") && c.playerRights >= 1) { try { String playerToBan = playerCommand.substring(9); for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToBan)) { Connection.unIPMuteUser(Server.playerHandler.players[i].connectedFrom); c.sendMessage("You have Un Ip-Muted the user: "+Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName); break; } } } } catch(Exception e) { c.sendMessage("Player Must Be Offline."); } if (playerCommand.startsWith("unmute") && c.playerRights >= 1) { try { String playerToBan = playerCommand.substring(7); Connection.unMuteUser(playerToBan); } catch(Exception e) { c.sendMessage("Player Must Be Offline."); } } } }

Read full topic

ps, if you indent your code, bracket errors are obvious.

           String playerToBan = playerCommand.substring(7);
           Connection.unMuteUser(playerToBan);
        } catch(Exception e) {
           c.sendMessage("Player Must Be Offline.");
		}
	}

}

}
[/code]
What is wrong with the code i keep getting, src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:827: reached end of file while parsing
Anyone know? I know why you get the error but i cant see problem in the code.
